abstract: The Continental Grain Company said that it had chosen to exit its roughly 6 percent position in Smithfield and wouldn’t challenge the pork company’s planned deal with Shuanghui International.
snippet: The Continental Grain Company said that it had chosen to exit its roughly 6 percent position in Smithfield and wouldn’t challenge the pork company’s planned deal with Shuanghui International.
lead_paragraph: 5:19 p.m. | Updated One of Smithfield Foods‘ biggest investors plans to drop its fight against the pork processor in light of its planned $4.7 billion sale to a Chinese meat producer.

headline.main: Continental Grain to Walk Away From Smithfield

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
